intro: Hieracium tunense, commonly known as the Tunisian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing, spreading habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium tunense is often found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to thrive in regions with mild winters and warm summers.
